name: Lime Wood Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had read some of the reviews on Tripadvisor before going and was slightly concerned at some of the negative ones. All I can say is that my husband and I enjoyed a superb lunch in the Dining Room yesterday - with considerable care and attention the moment we stepped inside the hotel from the moment we left. A special mention goes to Noemie who delightfully looked after us during our lunch. The setting is superb and the stylish design is both understated and stunning at the same time. We are undoubtedly looking forward to a return visit and stay, and have no hesitation in recommending it to others.
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.text: Just co-hosted a business lunch at this dream location in the New Forest. We had invited guests from some of the top companies in the area so it was really important to make a good impression. This is the second time we had come to Lime Wood so we knew what to expect. The whole ambience is "relaxed". On arrival, the reception staff made our guests very welcome and showed them to the bar where we were having drinks. We couldn't have asked for better attention. Everyone felt so comfortable and the experience extended to the meal itself. We were in a side room, off the main dining room, with views out to the Forest. What a great stress-buster for the busy executives who were attending. The meal itself was served unobtrusively by Daniel and his staff and the attendees were able to talk around the table without interruption. The Hotel offered a restricted but adequate menu and the choices were attractive, with a strong emphasis on local produce.
reviews.title: Class!
Just ok (for the money)
reviews.text: Having hosted similar events at other quality locations in the area, Lime Wood is head and shoulders above them all. As an organiser, you want your guests to go away with a warm feeling towards your business and the staff here played their part impeccably. This Hotel is class. It looks great and service quality is second to none.

Our room was on the first floor next to a door for staff only. I presume it led to the kitchen as the smell emanating from behind that door was very strong like fried onions. Our room was nicely decorated and the bathroom was romantic with the roll top bath and big shower (although the seal on the shower door wasn't great as the mat use to get soaking wet and the taps on the sink/pipes were noisy).
reviews.title: Very Good But Take Care...

reviews.text: It would have been nice when we came in if someone could show us around e.g. where breakfast will be served in the morning or where the spa is rather than leaving it to us to find our way.
reviews.title: If Carlsberg made hotels....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lime Wood: relaxation, recuperation, service, spa, comfortable and cosy. Limewood is Chewton Glen without the formality.
reviews.title: Go on! Treat yourselves...

reviews.text: This was our second visit and we were welcomed with an upgrade to the best suite in the hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful surroundings, top quality service - Part of Wedding party

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As always, the staff were fantastic - warm and relaxed, with the right level of attentiveness vs. privacy.
reviews.title: wonderful lunch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Head Barman of Max's Bar is fantastic - all energy and focus! - coupled with the opulence and relaxation of the spa this is THE place to come and unwind.
reviews.title: Lovely
Uhm....very very good...hard to fault
reviews.text: Luxurious furnishings, open log fires, thoughtful spa staff and the healthy Herb House menu cannot fail to disappoint.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a long weekend here recently and loved it. Lovely large room. The design throughout the hotel is inspired and the spa was one of the best I've been to. The food in both the scullery and dining room was very nice, the sommelier in particular was very good and the staff all very nice. There were a few issues; I have never stayed in a place where the domestic staff interfered with belongings so much in a room by tidying them away. I had to leave them a note to ask them to leave things were they were. The bicycles need some attention. There was a very uncomfortable 13 mile ride on a seat that kept tipping upwards. People smoking outside Raw and Cured can be smelt in the swimming pool which is a bit disgusting when you are swimming and exercising, so they should probably stop that, but all in all it's a great place and I can recommend it.
reviews.title: Fabulous place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow! My husband and I went to celebrate our anniversary with 2 nights to ourselves while our daughter was looked after by her grandparents. Granted, the sheer joy of being child free for a while and able to properly relax meant we would have enjoyed ourselves almost anywhere, but still Limewood was impressive and just the tonic we needed. Our 'Generous' room was beautifully appointed and very comfortable with a balcony looking out over the Forest. Welcome was friendly and just the right side of informal. There was a complimentary bottle of champagne in the room to congratulate us, which we were impressed with as I didn't even remember telling them when booking why we were there. Drinks in the bar were a joy and dinner in the Scullery on the first night was very enjoyable. Once again at the end of the meal we were bought a plate of petit fours one a plate piped with 'Congratulations' - really thoughtful. Limewood is so conducive to relaxation I defy anyone not to chill out while there - breakfasts in our room were fabulous, we took one of their walks through the New Forest and the only other living thing we met were wild horses, the spa treatments we had were divine (I feel asleep during my facial and reflexology), the outdoor spa pool is fabulous (we spent over an hour in there late afternoon with close to 0 degrees temperatures outside - the only thing missing here is the ability to order a glass of fizz while you wallow!!), the pool was lovely and almost empty, and the indoor hydrotherapy areas were great fun (and we had them to ourselves). Despite being full when we visited, we hardly saw any other guests except in the restaurants - it was very peaceful. The real surprise was dinner in the fine dining restaurant - it was sublime. We haven't had food like that outside of London for a long time.
reviews.title: The ultimate luxury - wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is difficult to think of anything we'd change - but the one thing would be to give guests first dibs on tables in the restaurants which are open to non residents. It is difficult to get a table if you haven't booked way in advance, especially in the fine dining restaurant, which is a travesty as its so good. Also, the hotel is very, very expensive. We were not complaining as we had the most wonderful time, but we did wince slightly when we saw the bill.
reviews.title: Sublime!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We often visit Babington House with our daughter if we want some family time away but we thought we'd give Limewood a try, even though it is more expensive. We weren't expecting to love it as much as we did. We have already booked to go back with our daughter next year.
reviews.title: Back to its glorious best

reviews.text: I booked Limewood for a surprise birthday weekend treat for my husbands birthday. I had read a few bits and pieces about the hotel and was particularly interested as it had a spa and a choice of eating places. I was not prepared for how gorgeous it was however! From the moment that we arrived we were shown to our room whilst our our car was parked. The grounds, landscaping and buildings in Limewood are stunning, fantastic styles and designs which all fit together leaving you wondering which part is original to the Regency main house. Our room(s) was in the crescent, a row of new Englandesque lodges, ours was on two floors with a log fire in the bedroom and the lounge. The attention to detail in the room and bathroom was gorgeous luxurious and very cool.The spa..ahh.. amazing, huge hydrotherapy pool, huge sauna, steam outdoor hot pool,(fab in the dark in the wind and rain!) Lovely music, very relaxing with views into the forest! The food was very good in both restaurants, we had our bedroom fire lit for when we returned from dinner each night wonderful! The small army of very discrete but impeccably mannered staff were very impressive and all seemed incredibly happy to be working there. We left Limewood with heavy hearts but rested souls, two days relaxing there felt like a week, I cant wait to go back! Loved it.
reviews.title: Nearly superb.....

reviews.text: Lime Wood is a class act. We couldn't fault it. We had a family birthday tea there in December and stayed the night. The tea was great and the staff were consistently courteous and professional. We ate in the Scullery which was fine but we couldn't do it full justice as we were still full of cakes, sandwiches and scones. Our room in the crescent was extremely comfortable. We particularly enjoyed the log fire. Our only wish is that we could afford to stay more often.
reviews.title: Happy Birthday

reviews.text: I took a small group of senior staff for a pre christmas meal, choosing the Lime wood Hotel as it is a stunning place in a fantastic setting!
reviews.title: Scullery restaurant was a little disappointing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been to the Lime Wood for lunch on a few occasions and everything was fine. Now without this sounding like an overcritical whinge, I do feel that if certain hotels and restaurants promote themselves to be at the top end of service and quality they should ensure that these standards are delivered. (Especially as this is what you pay for)
reviews.title: Perfect treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our meal at the Scullery was very average, we ordered two lobster and fillet steak main courses at £45.00 the steak was overcooked and the lobster was drowned in bernaise sauce. The other mains were ok but lacked and wow factor.
reviews.title: what a treat

reviews.text: I asked for a bottle of sauternes desert wine as a treat with our deserts to be told by the waiter that they didn't have any!! About 10 minutes later he returned with a wine list with a half page choice of bottles, by this stage it was too late as everyone had finished there desserts?
reviews.title: Fantastic, World Class hotel and facilities, but at a cost (if that bothers you...)

aka: Lime Wood Hotel Lyndhurst, New Forest National Park
description: Lime Wood, a boutique country house hotel in England, is set in the heart of the New Forest National Park, 1.5 miles from the small town of Lyndhurst and just an hour and a half drive from London. We like to think of ourselves as a luxury country house hotel with a difference. We've used Lime Wood's classical structure as the basis of our design but we've lovingly renovated it with a fresh approach, reviving its architecture and grounds. We've kept the spirit of its past, taken inspiration from its extraordinarily beautiful surroundings and added the odd contemporary twist to bring it to life. The food is by Luke Holder and Angela Hartnett. With its proximity to London, our New Forest boutique hotel really is the ultimate countryside getaway; perfect for weekend breaks, a dash from the city, or an escape from home; whatever your motivations, we can't wait to show you around.
